org.google.translate.api.v2.core
Class Translator

java.lang.Object
  org.google.translate.api.v2.core.Translator
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Closeable
public class Translator
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Closeable

Provides access to the Google Translate API v2.

  • translate - Translates source text from source language to target language
  • languages - List the source and target languages supported by the translate methods
  • detect - Detect language of source text

Field Summary
static int MAX_SOURCE_TEXTS
          Used to automatically avoid the Google API "Too many text segments" error - the detect(String[]) and translate(String[], String, String) methods, internally split the sourceTexts array if needed.

Field Detail

MAX_SOURCE_TEXTS

public static final int MAX_SOURCE_TEXTS
Used to automatically avoid the Google API "Too many text segments" error - the detect(String[]) and translate(String[], String, String) methods, internally split the sourceTexts array if needed.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

Translator

public Translator(java.lang.String apiKey)
Create a Translator to allow access to the API using the apiKey and a DefaultHttpClient.\ After use, the translator should be closed using the close() method.

Parameters:
apiKey - The Google account API key to use in order to access Google APIs, see Using REST, authentication

Translator

public Translator(java.lang.String apiKey,
                  HttpClient httpClient)
Create a Translator to allow access to the API using the apiKey and a HttpClient. After use, the translator should be closed using the close() method.

Parameters:
apiKey - The Google account API key to use in order to access Google APIs, see Using REST, authentication
httpClient - The HTTP client to use when accessing the Google Translate API
Method Detail

translate

public Translation translate(java.lang.String sourceText,
                             java.lang.String sourceLanguage,
                             java.lang.String targetLanguage)
                      throws java.io.IOException,
                             java.net.URISyntaxException,
                             TranslatorException
Translating sourceText from sourceLanguage to targetLanguage.

Parameters:
sourceText - The text to translate (Must be 5K or less due to Google Translate API limitations)
sourceLanguage - The language code of the source text or null for auto detection.
targetLanguage - The language code to translate to.
Returns:
The translation result.
Throws:
java.net.URISyntaxException - In case of a malformed URI
java.io.IOException - In case of an HTTP exception
TranslatorException - In case Google Translate API returned an error.

translate

public Translation[] translate(java.lang.String[] sourceTexts,
                               java.lang.String sourceLanguage,
                               java.lang.String targetLanguage)
                        throws java.net.URISyntaxException,
                               java.io.IOException,
                               TranslatorException
Translating sourceText from sourceLanguage to targetLanguage.

Parameters:
sourceTexts - Texts to translate - each text can be in a different language (The total size of the texts must be 5K or less due to Google Translate API limitations). Not limited by number of texts.
sourceLanguage - The language code of the source text or null for auto detection.
targetLanguage - The language code to translate to.
Returns:
The translation results.
Throws:
java.net.URISyntaxException - In case of a malformed URI
java.io.IOException - In case of an HTTP exception
TranslatorException - In case Google Translate API returned an error.

languages

public Language[] languages(java.lang.String targetLanguage)
                     throws java.net.URISyntaxException,
                            java.io.IOException,
                            TranslatorException
Lists the supported languages. These languages can be used as the values of the sourceLanguage and targetLanguage for the different API methods.

Parameters:
targetLanguage - Language code - If not null, the list of supported languages will contain the name of the language in the targetLanguage
Returns:
Array of supported languages
Throws:
java.net.URISyntaxException - In case of a malformed URI
java.io.IOException - In case of an HTTP exception
TranslatorException - In case Google Translate API returned an error.

detect

public Detection[][] detect(java.lang.String[] sourceTexts)
                     throws java.net.URISyntaxException,
                            java.io.IOException,
                            TranslatorException
Detects the language of a text.

Parameters:
sourceTexts - Texts to detect - each text can be in a different language (The total size of the texts must be 5K or less due to Google Translate API limitations). Not limited by number of texts.
Returns:
Matrix of detections - each detections[i] corresponds to sourceTexts[i] - if sourceTexts[i] can be associated with more than one language, detections[i] can contain multiple Detection objects.
Throws:
java.net.URISyntaxException - In case of a malformed URI
java.io.IOException - In case of an HTTP exception
TranslatorException - In case Google Translate API returned an error.

createHttpPost

protected HttpPost createHttpPost(java.net.URI uri,
                                  java.lang.String[] sourceTexts,
                                  int fromIndex,
                                  int toIndex)
                           throws java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException
Creates an HttpPost with a q parameter for every source text.
Using POST so the limit of the q parameter will be 5K instead of a 2K limit for the URL when using GET.

Parameters:
uri - The URI to pass to the HttpPost#HttpPost(java.net.URI) constructor.
sourceTexts - The texts to add as multiple q parameters, only texts from fromIndex to toIndex will be sent
fromIndex - Starting index for the sourceTexts array (inclusive)
toIndex - Ending index for the sourceTexts array (exclusive)
Returns:
The created HttpPost
Throws:
java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException - if the PARAMETERS_ENCODING isn't supported

createURI

protected java.net.URI createURI(java.lang.String path,
                                 java.util.List<BasicNameValuePair> getParams)
                          throws java.net.URISyntaxException
Creates a URI from the SCHEMA, HOST, default port, path and parameters.

Parameters:
path - The path section of the URI
getParams - the parameters for the GET method
Returns:
The created URI
Throws:
java.net.URISyntaxException - If both a scheme and a path are given but the path is relative, if the URI string constructed from the given components violates RFC 2396, or if the authority component of the string is present but cannot be parsed as a server-based authority

readResponse

protected <T extends AbstractResponse> T readResponse(HttpUriRequest httpUriRequest,
                                                      java.lang.Class<T> clazz)
                                           throws java.io.IOException,
                                                  TranslatorException
Executes the request and creates a clazz instance from the response.

Type Parameters:
T - Any class that extends AbstractResponse.
Parameters:
httpUriRequest - The request object
clazz - The class that the request represents
Returns:
An object of type clazz that was created from the content of the response.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If an exception occurred while executing the request, reading the response or converting the response to an instance of clazz.
TranslatorException - In case Google Translate API returned an error.

close

public void close()
Shuts down the connection manager and invalidates this Translator instance.
